verses.roman:
sūta uvāca
evaṁ stutaḥ sa bhagavān
ādi-devaḥ satāṁ gatiḥ
parituṣṭaḥ prasannātmā
prahasaṁs tam abhāṣata

synonyms: sūtaḥ uvāca—Sūta Gosvāmī said; evam—in these words; stutaḥ—praised; saḥ—he; bhagavān—the powerful Lord Śiva; ādi-devaḥ—the foremost of demigods; satām—of the saintly devotees; gatiḥ—the shelter; parituṣṭaḥ—perfectly satisfied; prasanna-ātmā—happy in his mind; prahasan—smiling; tam—to Mārkaṇḍeya; abhāṣata—spoke.
translation: Sūta Gosvāmī said: Lord Śiva, the foremost demigod and the shelter of the saintly devotees, was satisfied by Mārkaṇḍeya's praise. Pleased, he smiled and addressed the sage.
